page.title: 02Sandhurst/Crowthorne History
page.content: {SANDHURST}itself dates back to a settlement of Saxon origin on the banks of the Blackwater - this was called "Hurst". During the reign of { {Henry VIII}the breeding of sheep was introduced into the area. Part of the area marks an extremity of Windsor Forest, and it is said that {George {III}owned a hunting lodge here. {Little Sandhurst,}which has the nicknam "Cock-a-doby", is an area close to Sandhurst which it is rumoured was originally occupied by gypsies and railway workers. There are several references to cock fighting in local area and house names. Since the late 1950's there has been a large amount of housing development, and the area is almost exclusively "commuter belt". There are no main ameneties or shopping facilities in Little Sandhurst.
